{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3449669,"name":"","username":"thegravitor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thegravitor/{size}/237066_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-20T01:12:00.250Z","cooked":"

My team is trying to decide what to make out base and sides out of for out swerve this is are first year and we are at a standstill about it. So we would like to know what other people think are the best materials to do this.

Thank you

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-11-20T01:12:00.250Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":374,"readers_count":373,"score":139.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":475227,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of/475227/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3449674,"name":null,"username":"rainyskies","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rainyskies/{size}/222295_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-20T01:22:43.212Z","cooked":"

Swerve drivetrains are typically assembled from 2x1 aluminum tubing. Consider options from WCP, TTB, REV, or Last Anvil with prepunched holes. Also Consider buying your own 2x1 tubing from other sources preferably 6061 or 7075 aluminum. Some teams also use 2x1 brass to lower CoG. The base is often assembled out of Polycarbonate, AKA lexan. But they can also be made from sheet aluminum. Reference this design:

frcdesign.org

2910's Charged Up Drivebase | FRCDesign.org

A comprehensive learning guide and technical reference for FRC design using Onshape.

We ran standard 1/8" wall 1"x2" aluminum box tube, as well as a pocketed 1/8" steel bellypan. Super easy, super durable.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-11-20T01:29:00.794Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":344,"readers_count":343,"score":158.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":475227,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of","display_username":"RoboLancers 321 | LANCE-A-LOT 427 | FIRST Business Development Manager","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54687,"username":"rainyskies","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rainyskies/{size}/222295_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56826,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RoboLancers 321 | LANCE-A-LOT 427"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of/475227/3","custom_user_title":"RoboLancers 321 | LANCE-A-LOT 427","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3449686,"name":"Eugene_EB","username":"Eugene_EB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eugene_eb/{size}/235766_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-20T01:51:35.497Z","cooked":"

Like others have said, 2x1 tubing and aluminum belly pan is the way to go. We use the SDS MK4i modules which act as the corners of the frame with their bottom plate sandwitching the tube. Last year we did 1/16" aluminum belly pan as we had frame rails running across the inside of the frame to help “pull up” and support the middle of the belly pan and especially the battery.

If you dont want to do cross frame suports and have a completly open belly pan for electronics, then I would do 1/8" aluminum, once again just bolted or riveted to the bottom of the frame tubes. Being 1/8" provides enough strength to mount your battery in the middle (for centralized CG) and provide regidity to the frame despite the lack of interframe cross tubes.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-11-20T01:51:35.497Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":320,"readers_count":319,"score":74.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":475227,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of","display_username":"Eugene_EB","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67716,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2486 Design/Mech Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of/475227/4","custom_user_title":"2486 Design/Mech Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3449689,"name":"Eugene_EB","username":"Eugene_EB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eugene_eb/{size}/235766_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-20T01:54:38.419Z","cooked":"

If you make your belly pan out of flat aluminum, no pocketing, it will help to keep everything cleaner and keep things out of electronics

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-11-20T01:54:38.419Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":55.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":475227,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of","display_username":"Eugene_EB","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67716,"username":"Eugene_EB","name":"Eugene_EB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eugene_eb/{size}/235766_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67716,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2486 Design/Mech Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of/475227/5","custom_user_title":"2486 Design/Mech Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3449690,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-20T01:55:07.772Z","cooked":"

my favorite method is to use a thick plate, say 1/2 inch or larger, mill the swerve bearing pickup holes into that plate itself, and isogrid the rest.

If you prefer a non-conductive material that is pretty stiff for the belly pan, plywood works too (but it’s not very fancy)

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-11-20T02:36:21.908Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":246,"readers_count":245,"score":49.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":475227,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of","display_username":"Mike","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53190,"username":"truher","name":"joel truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50093,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of/475227/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3457668,"name":"Elliot S","username":"ElliotS","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elliots/{size}/177628_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-11T03:23:00.314Z","cooked":"

FYI, Just going to put this thread back at the top of CD instead of making a new one.

What do you make your frame rails out of?

With all the damage we saw in the 2024 game what are you planning on making your frame rails out of next year?
I know my team used 2x1 steel rails but realized we were running out of wight so we removed the tube on the intake side(under the bumper intake/back of the robot) and later our shooting side(front) for 2x1 pre-drilled aluminum tubes from.
For the belly pan we used perforated polycarb because that is what we are familiar with and our electrical lead likes it.

I was in favor of trying to get some 3x1 tubing to lower the belly pan and in turn lower the CG a little. But that also might make it stronger, what do people think? If you did lower the belly pan did you use 3x1 tubing, 2x1 tubing plus 1x1 tubing or just some spacer/standoffs?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-12-11T03:23:00.314Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":43.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475227,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of","display_username":"Elliot S","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of/475227/8","custom_user_title":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3457691,"name":"Eugene_EB","username":"Eugene_EB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eugene_eb/{size}/235766_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-11T04:26:45.414Z","cooked":"
ElliotS:

But that also might make it stronger, what do people think? If you did lower the belly pan did you use 3x1 tubing, 2x1 tubing plus 1x1 tubing or just some spacer/standoffs?

Our team just used standard 2x1 this year, but take citrus for example:

image1356×1078 115 KB

they used sections of 1X1 tube ontop of the normal 2x1 to drop the belly pan.

We are prolly gonna do that the next time that there is no cable protector on the feild, and you can have a super low to the ground belly pan.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-12-11T04:26:45.414Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":49.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":475227,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of","display_username":"Eugene_EB","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67716,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2486 Design/Mech Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of/475227/9","custom_user_title":"2486 Design/Mech Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3457811,"name":"","username":"Liamthebuildgoon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/liamthebuildgoon/{size}/238117_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-11T14:47:14.211Z","cooked":"

If your going for speed a solid choice would be to use aluminum 6061, it’s got a very good weight-to-strength ratio while not costing a fortune. Our team definitely uses this alloy of aluminum the most.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-12-11T14:47:14.211Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":34.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":475227,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65803,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Safety Captain"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-make-there-swerve-base-and-side-out-of/475227/10","custom_user_title":"Safety Captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3457816,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-11T14:58:39.813Z","cooked":"

Remember if you lower the belly pan:

Pay close attention to what fasntner heads stick out the bottom. Sure the belly pan itself may clear all the obstacles on the field in cad, but it only takes one pop rivet to get you high centered on a cable protector.

Also be careful of your bellypan lowering even further if you have Colson’s that are wearing down.
